action.action-desc: Mr. Weiner introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To require certain return policies from businesses that purchase precious metals from consumers and solicit such transactions through an Internet website.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Guarantee of a Legitimate Deal Act of 2009.

section.header: Return requirements for purchasers of precious metals

subsection.text: It shall be unlawful for any online purchaser of precious metals to—

paragraph.text: refine through melting or otherwise permanently destroy an item of jewelry or precious metal which the online purchaser of precious metals has made an offer to purchase before receiving an affirmative acceptance of such offer from the consumer to whom such offer was made;
fail to promptly return to the consumer any jewelry or other precious metal if the consumer declines the offer to purchase made by the online purchaser of precious metals; or
fail to insure any shipment of such jewelry or precious metals in an amount equal to—

subparagraph.text: 60 percent of the melt-value of the jewelry or precious metals; or

the amount the consumer insured the shipment of the jewelry or precious metals to the online purchaser of precious metals, if the consumer provides the online purchaser of precious metals with proof of such insurance.

paragraph.text: the term online purchaser of precious metals means a person who—

the term melt-value means the estimated value of any item of jewelry or precious metal, as determined by the online purchaser of precious metals, once such item has been processed and refined by the online purchaser of precious metals.

section.header: Enforcement by the Federal Trade Commission

subsection.header: unfair and deceptive act or practice
subsection.text: A violation of this Act shall be treated as an unfair and deceptive act or practice in violation of a regulation under section 18(a)(1)(B) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (15 U.S.C. 57a(a)(1)(B)) regarding unfair or deceptive acts or practices.

The Commission shall enforce this Act in the same manner, by the same means, and with the same jurisdiction, powers, and duties as though all applicable terms and provisions of the Federal Trade Commission Act (15 U.S.C. 41 et seq.) were incorporated into and made a part of this Act. Any person who violates such regulations shall be subject to the penalties and entitled to the privileges and immunities provided in that Act.
